verses.verse: He <WH376>, that being often reproved <WH8433> hardeneth <WH7185> his neck <WH6203>, shall suddenly <WH6621> be destroyed <WH7665>, and that without remedy <WH4832>. He: Heb. A man of reproofs
When the righteous <WH6662> are in authority <WH7235>, the people <WH5971> rejoice <WH8055>: but when the wicked <WH7563> beareth rule <WH4910>, the people <WH5971> mourn <WH584>. in: or, increased
Whoso <WH376> loveth <WH157> wisdom <WH2451> rejoiceth <WH8055> his father <WH1>: but he that keepeth company <WH7462> with harlots <WH2181> spendeth <WH6> his substance <WH1952>.
The king <WH4428> by judgment <WH4941> establisheth <WH5975> the land <WH776>: but he <WH376> that receiveth gifts <WH8641> overthroweth <WH2040> it. he: Heb. a man of oblations
A man <WH1397> that flattereth <WH2505> his neighbour <WH7453> spreadeth <WH6566> a net <WH7568> for his feet <WH6471>.
In the transgression <WH6588> of an evil <WH7451> man <WH376> there is a snare <WH4170>: but the righteous <WH6662> doth sing <WH7442> and rejoice <WH8056>.
The righteous <WH6662> considereth <WH3045> the cause <WH1779> of the poor <WH1800>: but the wicked <WH7563> regardeth <WH995> not to know <WH1847> it.
Scornful <WH3944> men <WH582> bring <WH6315> a city <WH7151> into a snare <WH6315>: but wise <WH2450> men turn away <WH7725> wrath <WH639>. bring: or, set a city on fire
If a wise <WH2450> man <WH376> contendeth <WH8199> with a foolish <WH191> man <WH376>, whether he rage <WH7264> or laugh <WH7832>, there is no rest <WH5183>.
The bloodthirsty <WH582> <WH1818> hate <WH8130> the upright <WH8535>: but the just <WH3477> seek <WH1245> his soul <WH5315>. The bloodthirsty: Heb. Men of blood
A fool <WH3684> uttereth <WH3318> all his mind <WH7307>: but a wise <WH2450> man keepeth <WH7623> it in till afterwards <WH268>.
If a ruler <WH4910> hearken <WH7181> to lies <WH1697> <WH8267>, all his servants <WH8334> are wicked <WH7563>.
The poor <WH7326> and the deceitful <WH8501> man <WH376> meet together <WH6298>: the LORD <WH3068> lighteneth <WH215> both <WH8147> their eyes <WH5869>. the deceitful: or, the usurer
The king <WH4428> that faithfully <WH571> judgeth <WH8199> the poor <WH1800>, his throne <WH3678> shall be established <WH3559> for ever <WH5703>.
The rod <WH7626> and reproof <WH8433> give <WH5414> wisdom <WH2451>: but a child <WH5288> left <WH7971> to himself bringeth his mother <WH517> to shame <WH954>.
When the wicked <WH7563> are multiplied <WH7235>, transgression <WH6588> increaseth <WH7235>: but the righteous <WH6662> shall see <WH7200> their fall <WH4658>.
Correct <WH3256> thy son <WH1121>, and he shall give thee rest <WH5117>; yea, he shall give <WH5414> delight <WH4574> unto thy soul <WH5315>.
Where there is no vision <WH2377>, the people <WH5971> perish <WH6544>: but he that keepeth <WH8104> the law <WH8451>, happy <WH835> is he. perish: or, is made naked
A servant <WH5650> will not be corrected <WH3256> by words <WH1697>: for though he understand <WH995> he will not answer <WH4617>.
Seest <WH2372> thou a man <WH376> that is hasty <WH213> in his words <WH1697>? there is more hope <WH8615> of a fool <WH3684> than of him. words: or, matters?
He that delicately bringeth up <WH6445> his servant <WH5650> from a child <WH5290> shall have him become his son <WH4497> at the length <WH319>.
An angry <WH639> man <WH376> stirreth up <WH1624> strife <WH4066>, and a furious <WH2534> man <WH1167> aboundeth in <WH7227> transgression <WH6588>.
A man's <WH120> pride <WH1346> shall bring him low <WH8213>: but honour <WH3519> shall uphold <WH8551> the humble <WH8217> in spirit <WH7307>.
Whoso is partner <WH2505> with a thief <WH1590> hateth <WH8130> his own soul <WH5315>: he heareth <WH8085> cursing <WH423>, and bewrayeth <WH5046> it not.
The fear <WH2731> of man <WH120> bringeth <WH5414> a snare <WH4170>: but whoso putteth his trust <WH982> in the LORD <WH3068> shall be safe <WH7682>. safe: Heb. set on high
Many <WH7227> seek <WH1245> the ruler's <WH4910> favour <WH6440>; but every man's <WH376> judgment <WH4941> cometh from the LORD <WH3068>. the ruler's: Heb. the face of a ruler
An unjust <WH5766> man <WH376> is an abomination <WH8441> to the just <WH6662>: and he that is upright <WH3477> in the way <WH1870> is abomination <WH8441> to the wicked <WH7563>.
